p: Also, the flower extract was used to test the susceptibility of R. ferrugineus larvae at the concentrations of 2.8, 4.2, 6.0, 7.0 and 8.0 ppm. Results showed that percentage of mortalities were as follows; 55, 70, 75, 80 and 85, respectively. The concentrations reflected an LC 50 of 2.6 ppm, an LC 95 of 9.6 ppm. The lowest concentration (2.8 ppm) produced 55% mortality, whereas the highest concentration (8 ppm) reflected 85% mortality and the R-square was 0.76.
